dataSource.label: TruckingRoutes
dataSource.title: Trucking
dataSource.text: Geolocation data set with latitude and longitude coordinates collected on a minute-by-minute basis for approximately 500,000 US-based trucks

dataSource.label: RentalRates
dataSource.title: Rental Rate
dataSource.text: Provides rentatl rates for 49 million transactions across 160,000 distinct properties in more than 7,000 ZIP Codes from a leading real estate database company

dataSource.label: IndustrialPois
dataSource.title: Industrial POIs
dataSource.text: Points of interest for shipping and delivery identified by lat/long coordinates enriched with mapped polygons and connected to relevant retailers.

dataSource.label: HousingPermits
dataSource.title: Housing Permits
dataSource.text: Provides rentatl rates for 49 million transactions across 160,000 distinct properties in more than 7,000 ZIP Codes from a leading real estate database company

dataSource.label: ConsumerSpend
dataSource.title: Consumer Spending
dataSource.text: Consumer spending data comes from a representative panel of over 40 million consumer credit cards sampled from 95% of active cards in the United States.

dataSource.label: Geosocial
dataSource.title: Geosocial
dataSource.text: Social media content (mostly text) produced by people on social platforms that is tied to a specific location. Sourced from every major social platform including Twitter, Instagram, Flickr, event platforms, review sites, etc.

dataSource.label: IncomeAndEmployment
dataSource.title: Income & Employment
dataSource.text: Payroll records from a top-3 payroll service provider

dataSource.label: JobPostings
dataSource.title: Job Postings
dataSource.text: Millions of job postings from hundreds of different portals and job placement sites

income.title: Gross Income Per Capita
income.methodology: 10th, 25th, 50th, 75th, and 90th percentiles of Median Gross Income. Computed as a percentile for the target granularity relative to the submarket

income.title: Household Income
income.methodology: 20th, 40th, 60th, 80th, and 95th percentiles of Median Household Income. Computed as a percentile for the target granularity relative to the submarket

income.title: Savings Rate
income.methodology: Mean per capita savings rate is computed as Median Net Income - Per Capita Credit & Debit Card Spending - Median Rent Price

income.title: Gross Income by Age
income.methodology: Median gross income distribution by age

housing.title: Rent to Income
housing.methodology: Computed as Median Rent / Median Gross Income

housing.title: Household Size
housing.methodology: The average number of people who occupy a housing unit as their primary place of residence

housing.title: Household Formation Rate
housing.methodology: Year-over-year growth in the number of total households

housing.title: Months Rent to Down Payment
housing.methodology: The average number of months of rent required to meet a 20% down payment in a given market

demographics.title: % Full Time vs Part Time
demographics.methodology: Proportion of full time vs. part-time employees

demographics.title: Marital Status
demographics.methodology: Proportion of married, single, divorced, and widowed individuals

demographics.title: Age Distribution
demographics.text: Distribution of age buckets for the working population of each market computed for each geographic granularity sourced from Payroll Intelligence.
demographics.methodology: Working population broken down by age

demographics.title: Education Distribution
demographics.methodology: Distribution of educational attainment by the adult (18+) population

employment.title: Professional Makeup
employment.methodology: The Top 10 sectors that people who live within a given market are employed in. Based on NAICS 2-digit sector codes. Percentage is computed as the number of employees within a sector divided by the total population of the market.

employment.title: Industry Breakout
employment.methodology: Professional makeup which shows the percent of people employed within a given industry (NAICS6) for each market. Percentage is computed as the number of employees within an industry divided by the total population of the market.

employment.title: Growth in New Hiring
employment.methodology: Year-over-year growth in the number of newly hired employees across all sectors within a given geographic area.

employment.title: Top Recruiting Professions
employment.methodology: Top-five professions recruiting in the market. Computed as the sum of individual job postings for each unique profession as defined by O*NET codes.

employment.title: Top Recruiting Employers
employment.methodology: Top-five companies recruiting in the market. Computed as the sum of individual job postings for each unique employer.

gentrification.title: Neighborhood Income Fit
gentrification.text: This plot shows how the relationship between these two variables changes over time and how the changing income dynamic may point towards gentrification within a neighborhood.
gentrification.methodology: Median gross Income percentile plotted against the percentile of the % of the population that earns over $100K. Percentiles are computed relative to the submarket

gentrification.title: Gentrification Similarity
gentrification.methodology: A similarity score is computed for each zip code in the US to every other zip code based on metrics from input data sources. Similarities between zip codes are then computed for each month in the input data set.

gentrification.title: Income Distribution
gentrification.methodology: Distribution of the population which falls within pre-defined income bands shown as a percentage of the total working population.

gentrification.title: Rent Growth
gentrification.methodology: Year-over-year growth in median rents for a given market.

gentrification.title: Gen Y Income YoY
gentrification.methodology: Year-over-year growth in median income for those that fall within the Gen Y category (born after 1980).

gentrification.title: Cultural Indicators
gentrification.methodology: Percentile rankings of the three geosocial indices that have shown the highest correlation to gentrification within a neighborhood. Percentiles are computed against the MSA.
